settings.title: Tour Settings
settings.enableToursDescription: Show tour suggestions when entering empty sections
settings.resetToursDescription: Allow tours to show again for all sections

dossier.name: Creating Your First Dossier
dossier.description: Learn how to create and organize dossiers for countries, organizations, and more.

welcome.title: Welcome to Dossiers!
welcome.content: Dossiers are your central hub for organizing information about countries, organizations, forums, and other key entities. Let's walk through creating your first one.
welcome.hint: Dossiers can contain documents, relationships, engagements, and intelligence signals.

typeSelection.title: Choose Your Dossier Type
typeSelection.content: Select the type that best matches what you're tracking. Each type has specialized fields and features.
typeSelection.hint: Country dossiers include maps and flag visualizations. Organization dossiers track structure and contacts.

basicInfo.title: Fill in Basic Information
basicInfo.content: Every dossier needs a name and basic details. This helps you find and organize your dossiers later.
basicInfo.hint: Be descriptive but concise – you can add more details in the dossier's sections.

bilingual.title: Bilingual Support
bilingual.content: Enter names in both English and Arabic to support your team's language preferences.
bilingual.hint: Arabic names are displayed when the interface is in Arabic mode.

finish.title: You're Ready to Go!
finish.content: That's all the basics! Once created, you can add documents, track relationships, and build a complete picture of your subject.

relationship.name: Connecting Your Data
relationship.description: Discover how to create relationships between dossiers and visualize your network.

intro.title: Understanding Relationships
intro.content: Relationships connect your dossiers together, creating a network of linked information that you can explore and analyze.
intro.hint: Track partnerships, memberships, collaborations, and more.

sourceTarget.title: Connect Two Entities
sourceTarget.content: Select the source and target dossiers you want to connect. The relationship flows from source to target.

type.title: Define the Relationship Type
type.content: Choose how these entities are connected. This helps categorize and filter your relationship network.
type.hint: Common types: Partnership, Membership, Collaboration, Subsidiary

graphView.title: Visualize Your Network
graphView.content: Switch to graph view to see your relationships as an interactive network diagram. Zoom, pan, and explore connections.
graphView.hint: Click on nodes to navigate to dossiers, or drag to rearrange the layout.

finish.title: Start Building Your Network!
finish.content: You now know how to create and visualize relationships. Start connecting your dossiers to build a comprehensive network.

document.name: Uploading Documents
document.description: Learn to attach and organize documents within your dossiers.

intro.title: Documents Keep Everything Together
intro.content: Attach relevant files to your dossiers – agreements, reports, correspondence, and more. Everything stays organized and accessible.
intro.hint: Supported formats: PDF, Word, Excel, images, and more.

upload.title: Upload Your First Document
upload.content: Drag and drop files or click to browse. You can upload multiple documents at once.
upload.hint: Large files may take a moment to upload. Progress is shown for each file.

classification.title: Classify for Security
classification.content: Set the appropriate classification level for your documents. This controls who can view and access them.
classification.hint: Follow your organization's data classification guidelines.

finish.title: Keep Your Documents Organized!
finish.content: Upload documents as you work to keep all relevant files in one place. You can preview, download, or delete them anytime.

engagement.name: Tracking Engagements
engagement.description: Record meetings, conferences, and interactions with international partners.

intro.title: Track Every Interaction
intro.content: Engagements capture meetings, conferences, workshops, and other interactions. Build a complete history of your international activities.
intro.hint: Link engagements to dossiers to see the full picture.

type.title: Select Engagement Type
type.content: Choose the type that best describes this engagement. This helps with reporting and analysis.
type.hint: Types include: Meeting, Conference, Workshop, Official Visit, Phone Call

dates.title: Set the Timeline
dates.content: Record when the engagement starts and ends. For single-day events, the end date is optional.
dates.hint: Past engagements can be logged for historical records.

participants.title: Add Participants
participants.content: Record who was involved – both internal team members and external contacts.
participants.hint: Participants can be linked to person dossiers for detailed tracking.

finish.title: Start Logging Engagements!
finish.content: After creating an engagement, add after-action records to capture outcomes, decisions, and commitments.

brief.name: Generating AI Briefs
brief.description: Use AI to generate comprehensive briefing documents from your dossier data.

intro.title: AI-Powered Briefings
intro.content: Generate comprehensive briefing documents using AI. Briefs pull together information from your dossier's documents, engagements, and relationships.
intro.hint: Great for preparing for meetings or creating executive summaries.

aiGenerate.title: Generate with AI
aiGenerate.content: Click to have AI analyze your dossier's content and generate a structured briefing document.
aiGenerate.hint: Generation typically takes 30-60 seconds depending on content volume.

customize.title: Customize Your Brief
customize.content: After generation, you can edit and customize the brief. Add context, adjust sections, or highlight key points.
customize.hint: Briefs can be exported as PDF or Word documents.

finish.title: Generate Your First Brief!
finish.content: AI briefs save hours of preparation time. The more data in your dossier, the richer the generated brief.

position.name: Documenting Positions
position.description: Record and track official positions on international topics.

intro.title: Maintain Consistent Positions
intro.content: Document your organization's official positions on international topics. This ensures consistency across all engagements.
intro.hint: Positions can be linked to specific dossiers and topics.

topic.title: Define the Topic
topic.content: Clearly state what topic or issue this position addresses. Be specific to avoid confusion.
topic.hint: Example: 'Climate Change Carbon Reduction Targets' rather than just 'Climate'

stance.title: State Your Position
stance.content: Document the official stance and rationale. Include any supporting arguments or talking points.
stance.hint: Include context on when this position was established and by whom.

finish.title: Document Your Positions!
finish.content: Well-documented positions ensure your team speaks with one voice. Reference them during engagement preparation.

mou.name: Managing MOUs
mou.description: Track memoranda of understanding and their renewal dates.

intro.title: Track Your Agreements
intro.content: MOUs (Memoranda of Understanding) formalize partnerships. Track their status, terms, and renewal dates in one place.
intro.hint: Get notified before MOUs expire so you can plan renewals.

parties.title: Identify the Parties
parties.content: Specify who is party to this agreement. Link to existing organization or country dossiers.
parties.hint: Multi-party MOUs can include multiple organizations.

dates.title: Set Important Dates
dates.content: Record when the MOU was signed, when it takes effect, and when it expires.
dates.hint: Renewal reminders are sent 90, 60, and 30 days before expiration.

finish.title: Start Tracking MOUs!
finish.content: Keep your agreements organized and never miss a renewal. Attach the signed document for easy reference.

commitment.name: Tracking Commitments
commitment.description: Capture and follow up on promises made during engagements.

intro.title: Never Drop a Commitment
intro.content: Commitments are promises made during engagements – by your team or by external parties. Track them to ensure follow-through.
intro.hint: Commitments can be deliverables, follow-ups, or action items.

type.title: Categorize the Commitment
type.content: Is this a deliverable you need to produce, a follow-up with an external party, or an internal action item?
type.hint: Different types have different tracking workflows.

deadline.title: Set a Deadline
deadline.content: When does this need to be completed? Setting deadlines ensures accountability and enables reminders.
deadline.hint: Overdue commitments are highlighted in your work dashboard.

finish.title: Track Your Commitments!
finish.content: Commitments flow to your 'My Work' dashboard. Stay on top of promises and build trust with partners.
